content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No composite structure has been successfully placed during these steps. Multiple recovery updates targeted the Lab at position (0.5, 2.5), but all attempts—whether by direct placement or crafting—failed due to missing inventory items and insufficient sub-ingredients. Although the agent temporarily interacted with existing furnaces (an alternative furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) for iron plate smelting and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) for copper plate production), these were not newly created structures, and overall no new structure appears on the map.

ERROR TIPS
• API Misuse with get_entities: Incorrectly using a keyword argument (“radius”) and, later, providing extra positional arguments caused errors. Verify the API’s required parameters and ensure that only permitted arguments are passed.
• Lab Placement Failures: Attempts to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) failed because no Lab was available in inventory. Confirm inventory contents before initiating placement.
• Lab Crafting Chain Issues: Repeated lab crafting errors indicate missing sub-components (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) because prerequisite resources (like iron-plate and copper-plate) were not sufficiently produced. Ensure all production chains are fully established and that smelting and intermediate crafting processes are operational.
• NoneType Iteration Error: Filtering operations on the result from get_entities led to a “NoneType object is not iterable” error. Always validate that entity-retrieval functions return a list (or an empty list) before iterating over their results.
• Resource Shortage Monitoring: Despite smelting efforts, critical missing ingredients (for example, the final deficit of 2 iron-gear-wheels during lab crafting) persist. Closely monitor resource production and adjust processing priorities to avoid cascading shortages.
